page.title: 20Horsmonden Today
page.content: Today Horsmonden is a busy village surrounded by the intensely-cultivated Weald of Kent & still considerably dependent on farming & its services. There is much concern over the status of hard fruit & hops in the European Economic Community: in recent years many acres of traditional orchards & hop-gardens have been cleared as being uneconomic, & cereals planted. Heavy lorries serving fruit storage depots in the area are also of concern, damaging our lanes, swamping local traffic & shaking our homes. Public Transport is very limited: the railway line was closed in 1962, & more recently bus services have been cut. Those without cars worry about being isolated. It is not all idyll, living in the country in 1985!
